text:
( footsteps receding,
door closing )

Your mom was talking
to the mirror.

- She knows?
- My dad, too.

Do they know its history?
That it's Grace?

No, but we almost had
a fire today.

Fire trucks.
Lots of smoke. What?

Remember when
I told you about my dream?

That nightmare about smoke
and a fire?

Sure. The day you switched
places and got stuck.

In 1930, I learned
it wasn't a dream.

It was a vision.
I had more, too.

Glimpses of the future,
of things to come.
I have this gift.

The same gift that Grace had
of seeing into the future.

Bad things mostly,
like the smoke and fire

that I thought
was going to be in 1930,

but it must've
been the present,
the Tremont now.

No one found any fire.
They couldn't explain it.
Wow. You've been to the past

and you can see
into the future.
It's pretty impressive, Harper.
Why, thank you.
